intro: Smelowskia calycina var. media, commonly known as the narrow-leaved smelowskia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
